intro: Frangula chimantensis, commonly known as the Chimanté buckthorn, is a shrub native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and dark, glossy berries. The plant is adapted to high-altitude environments, often growing in rocky or forested areas. Its leaves are typically elliptical with a smooth margin, and the bark is thick and fissured. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological role and potential medicinal properties.
